reviews.review_msg: Horrible Proff. Went to ask a few questions during office hours, he didn't even answer my question. Test are hard and not fair/makes questions on material we never studied and I am a B+ A student in all my other courses. PLS if you don't want your GPA to go down, listen to the advice and don't take the course. On average everyone is at C- in his ca

AMAZING prof. Do not listen to what others are posting, His exams are COMPLETELY fair and based off of what he says and whats in the notes. No tricks. But the Course is very challenging and takes ALOT of memorization. He is a extremely helpful prof and cares for his students even after they complete the course. If only all my profs were like him.

this prof is the worst teacher you will ever have. if he's the only one teaching the course, take it the following sem with a different prof, seriously! his exams do not reflect the material covered in class and do not reflect your comprehension of the course material. he should seriously be fired because he clearly hates students

Great prof. Keeps course content interesting by drawing from recent clinical implications or health-related topics. Sometimes the content can be a bit dry, but that's just the nature of the subject. Her exams are very fair and she makes sure that the grading is treated farily.

Her marking scheme is quite fair for mbb 231. Here is the mark breakdown 30%midterm 1, 30% midterm 2, and 30% final, and 10% tutorial. She is really helpful and her exams are based on her lecture notes. I definitely recommend another class with Dr Bisgrove because I got a B- in this class which I had to repeat.

Dr Hawkins was a really great professor. She put time into helping students and really wanted everyone to succeed. 231 is a content heavy course in itself but Dr Hawkins made the questions really straight forward and provided a good handful of practice. Keep up with material and work hard and you'll do good

Wow if I could give a 0 i would give a 0. Some teachers are truly not meant to be professors and it truly shows through her. Yeah she put an unnecessary amount of stress, worry and depression among the students. Midterm avgs were lower than they've ever been and final was much more brutal. Would be shocked if she doesn't scale with THAT avg.

Exams were relatively strait forward. Material can get overwhelming, so keep up. She asks a few application questions which can skew your grades. The way she gives marks on exams is confusing, sometimes you get full marks other times you don't and asking doesn't help clarify why you did not receive the marks. Overall, shes a good teacher.
Nice and sweet but tests on lots of small fine detailed information such as one sentences from one lecture instead of the whole concept of the lectures.

Lectures are not recorded and she speaks pretty fast but overall I highly recommend this prof. The exams are extremely fair. Study the lecture notes and you'll be fine. The class is overall a lot of material but Nancy does a great job keeping your interest and being organized.
Very hard.  The exams do not reflect the big picture of what is taught its all about small details so memorization is key! Know absolutely everything on lecture slides or you won't get over a C.
lecture notes are organized and easy to understand. Exams are based on lecture notes
Gets way too excited about some topics like microtubules. Really funny guy. Bends over backwards to help students if you come and visit him.
Very nice prof...concise notes and fair exams.  I strongly recommend taking a course with him!
Very clear about what is expected of students. It's easy to tell that Nick cares about his students. His exams are straightforward and very fair. Highly recommended, he's a great professor.
